item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局对超过 87 万辆通用汽车展开初步调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，在收到有关通用汽车公司生产的877,710辆汽车发动机故障的报告后，正在对这些汽车展开初步调查。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday it was opening a preliminary probe into 877,710 vehicles manufactured by General Motors , after receiving reports alleging engine failure.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 利率上行削弱小盘股力量，小盘股失去特朗普的支撑
item.description: 在投资者寻找能在唐纳德-特朗普担任总统期间大放异彩的资产之际，美国股市有望从共和党政策中受益的一个角落却步履蹒跚。【原文：As investors seek assets that will shine under a Donald Trump presidency, one corner of the U.S. stock market expected to benefit from the Republican's policies has been stumbling.】

item.title: 早间竞标沃勒和贝森特帮助国债收益率回落
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 关注特朗普就职典礼，期货走高
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货上扬，S&P 500指数和道指有望创下11月以来的最大单周涨幅，而投资者则在等待即将上任的特朗普政府的一系列政策变化。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged up on Friday, with the S&P 500 and the Dow looking set to log their biggest weekly advances since November, while investors awaited a wave of policy changes under the incoming Trump administration.】

item.title: 企业为节省债务成本而进行的对冲可能加剧了 10 年期债券的抛售
item.description: 银行家和分析师们说，最近几周美国国债市场的抛售很可能因企业计划本月在债券市场上借入近1900亿美元而变得更加严重，这凸显了今年可能持续存在的市场风险。【原文：A sell-off in U.S. Treasury markets in recent weeks was likely made worse by corporate plans to borrow nearly $190 billion in the bond market this month, bankers and analysts said, highlighting a risk for markets that is likely to persist this year.】

item.title: 消息人士称，再保险公司放弃了对中东地区的一些限制
item.description: 业内人士告诉路透社，包括瑞士再保险公司在内的再保险公司在 1 月份的保单续保季中更愿意为中东地区提供保险，并取消了一项条款，即如果加沙冲突升级，再保险公司可以退出。【原文：Reinsurers, including Swiss Re , have become more willing to provide cover for the Middle East in the industry's January policy renewal season, removing a clause which allowed them to pull out if the Gaza conflict escalated, industry sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 特朗普开创新纪元，华尔街银行感受到放松资本规则的机遇
item.description: 据业内高管透露，由于即将上任的特朗普政府更加友好，而且他们去年成功削弱了提高资本金的草案，美国大型银行计划推动对美国其他资本金规则进行彻底改革。【原文：Emboldened by a friendlier incoming Trump administration and their success last year in weakening draft capital hikes, big U.S. banks plan to push to overhaul other U.S. capital rules, according to industry executives.】

item.title: Netflix 大力推广体育可能推动了假期季度用户增长
item.description: 由于 "杰克-保罗对迈克-泰森 "拳击赛的成功和美国国家橄榄球联盟（National Football League）热门比赛的首次亮相，Netflix 在体育赛事上的巨大赌注预计将推动假日季度新增 900 多万订户。【原文：Netflix's big bet on sports events is expected to have driven more than 9 million subscriber additions in the holiday quarter, lifted by the success of the "Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson" boxing match and the debut of popular National Football League games.】

item.title: 解说员拜登或特朗普仍能拯救 TikTok；方法如下
item.description: 当唐纳德-特朗普下令美国政府在 2020 年禁止流行的中国社交媒体应用 TikTok 时，他说这一 "积极行动 "是 "保护我们的国家安全 "所必需的。【原文：When Donald Trump ordered the U.S. government to ban popular Chinese social media app TikTok in 2020, he said the "aggressive action" was necessary "to protect our national security."】

item.title: 总统就职日的美股表现
item.description: 周二是唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）就任白宫第二任总统的第二天，投资者将密切关注股市的走势，以观察美国股市能否延续近期在总统宣誓就职后的上涨趋势。【原文：Investors will closely monitor stock markets on Tuesday, the day after Donald Trump is inaugurated for his second term in the White House, to see if U.S. equities can continue their recent trend of posting gains after a president is sworn in.】

item.title: Codelco 与沙特就铜矿投资进行谈判，2025 年产量有望增加
item.description: 智利的 Codelco 公司是世界上最大的铜生产商，该公司董事长周五在接受路透社采访时表示，该公司正在与沙特阿拉伯就潜在的金属联合投资进行谈判。【原文：Chile's Codelco, the world's largest copper producer, is in talks with Saudi Arabia over potential joint investments in the metal, the company's chairman told Reuters in an interview on Friday.】

item.title: TPG 和 Transneft 撤销了俄罗斯大亨在英国的 140 亿美元诉讼案
item.description: 美国私募股权公司 TPG 和俄罗斯国有企业俄罗斯原子能公司（Rosatom）和俄罗斯石油公司（Transneft）周五胜诉，阻止了狱中大亨齐亚武丁-马戈梅多夫（Ziyavudin Magomedov）在伦敦提起的价值 140 亿美元的诉讼，该诉讼涉嫌阴谋剥夺其资产。【原文：U.S. private equity firm TPG and Russian state-owned firms Rosatom and Transneft on Friday won their bid to block jailed tycoon Ziyavudin Magomedov's $14 billion London lawsuit over an alleged conspiracy to strip his assets.】

item.title: 中国启动补贴汽车以旧换新
item.description: 中国商务部周五启动了汽车以旧换新补贴项目，该项目类似于美国的 "旧车换现金 "刺激计划，去年该计划促进了中国的汽车销售。【原文：China's commerce ministry kicked off subsidised auto trade-ins on Friday, extending a program likened to the U.S. "cash-for-clunkers" stimulus that had bolstered China's car sales last year.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，美联储哈马克称通胀仍是个问题
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周五在接受《华尔街日报》采访时表示，通货膨胀仍然是一个问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said in an interview published in the Wall Street Journal on Friday that inflation remained a problem.】

item.title: 据《明镜》报道，大众汽车希望深化与美国电动汽车制造商 Rivian 的合作关系
item.description: 德国大众汽车公司首席执行官在周五发表的评论中告诉《明镜》杂志，该公司正在考虑如何深化与美国电动汽车制造商 Rivian 的合作关系。【原文：Volkswagen is considering ways to deepen its partnership with U.S. electric car maker Rivian, the German company's CEO told Spiegel magazine in comments published on Friday.】

item.title: 在航空会议上，ESG 因飞机短缺而退居其次
item.description: 本周，一年一度的大型航空金融会议在很大程度上绕开了可持续发展的话题--这与该行业通常在遏制排放方面的严密信息传递大相径庭，让一些代表对 "环境、社会和治理疲劳症 "的影响感到担忧。【原文：A major annual air finance gathering largely skirted round the topic of sustainability this week - a rare departure from the industry's usual tight messaging on curbing emissions that left some delegates concerned about the impact of "ESG fatigue".】

item.title: 美国国债收益率上升导致全球股票基金需求下降
item.description: 截至 1 月 15 日的一周内，全球股票基金的需求急剧下降，原因是美国国债收益率上升，而且在强劲的就业报告公布后，市场对美联储降息的预期下降。【原文：Demand for global equity funds declined sharply in the week through Jan. 15, as U.S. Treasury yields rose and expectations for the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts fell following a robust jobs report.】

item.title: 调查显示：日本企业为应对特朗普关税做好准备
item.description: 日本贸易振兴机构周五公布的一项调查显示，大多数在美国开展业务的日本公司都在为特朗普新政府可能征收额外关税做准备。【原文：Most Japanese companies with operations in the United States are preparing for possible additional tariffs under the incoming Trump administration, according to a survey released on Friday by the Japan External Trade Organization.】

item.title: 外资 12 月份连续第二个月撤出亚洲债券市场
item.description: 由于预计美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普将提高关税、美联储放缓宽松政策以及地区经济增长预期下降，亚洲债务市场在12月份连续第二个月出现外资流出，扭转了2024年早些时候的强劲需求。【原文：Asian debt markets saw foreign outflows in December, for the second month in a row, reversing strong demand from earlier in 2024 on anticipated higher U.S. tariffs under President-elect Donald Trump, slower easing by the Federal Reserve, and reduced regional growth expectations.】

item.title: 中国否认要求企业和个人非法提供数据
item.description: 中国外交部周五表示，中国政府 "从来没有也永远不会 "要求公司或个人以违反法律的方式为其收集数据或提供数据。【原文：The Chinese government "has never and will never" require companies or individuals to collect data for or provide data to it in a way that violates the law, China's foreign ministry said on Friday.】

item.title: 燃料需求达到峰值，中国庞大的炼油行业面临洗牌
item.description: 由于中国燃料需求的峰值早于预期，压低了利润率，而中国政府又开始努力榨干低效产能，挤压规模较小的老厂，因此在未来十年内，中国将有多达 10% 的炼油产能面临关闭。【原文：Up to 10% of China's oil refining capacity faces closure in the next ten years as an earlier-than-expected peak in Chinese fuel demand crushes margins and Beijing's drive to wring out inefficiency begins to squeeze older and smaller plants.】

item.title: 消息人士称，KKR 聘请高盛出售菲律宾金融科技玛雅公司股份
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，全球投资公司 KKR 已委托高盛（Goldman Sachs）出售其持有的菲律宾金融科技公司 Maya 的大量少数股权。【原文：Global investment firm KKR has appointed Goldman Sachs for the sale of its significant minority stake in Philippine fintech company Maya, according to two sources with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，日本央行可能维持鹰派政策承诺，下周加息
item.description: 熟悉日本央行想法的五位消息人士称，如果美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上任后不出现任何市场震荡，日本央行很可能在下周提高利率，并维持在经济持续复苏的情况下继续推高借贷成本的承诺。【原文：The Bank of Japan is likely to raise interest rates next week barring any market shocks when U.S. President-elect Donald Trump takes office, and maintain a pledge to keep pushing up borrowing costs if the economy continues to recover, said five sources familiar with its thinking.】

item.title: 投资者在债务重创的英国市场上承受长期痛苦
item.description: 由于英镑、政府债券和股票市场的动荡相互影响，并使英国面临对冲基金攻击潮的风险，长期受困于英国市场的投资者在享受短暂反弹的同时，也在为连续亏损而蛰伏。【原文：Investors who had been enjoying a brief rebound in long-suffering UK markets are hunkering down for a stretch of losses as ructions in the pound, government bonds and stocks feed on each other and put Britain at risk of a wave of hedge fund attacks.】

item.title: 特朗普就职标志着加密货币进入新时代
item.description: 在周一上任的当选总统唐纳德-特朗普做出一系列提名和顾问任命后，加密货币的倡导者和持有者将很快影响美国对这一新兴技术的政策。【原文：Advocates and holders of crypto will soon influence U.S. policy on the emerging technology after a slew of nominations and advisory appointments by President-elect Donald Trump, who takes office on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，印度首家太空初创企业被选中参与印美防务计划
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，七家印度私营公司已被选中参与印度-美国太空与防务合作计划，这将为印度公司打开一个利润丰厚的战略市场。【原文：Seven Indian private companies have been chosen for a first-of-its-kind India-U.S. space and defence collaboration programme, unlocking a lucrative and strategic market for Indian firms, said three sources with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 早间新闻特朗普就职典礼在即，本周谨慎收官
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 中国买家在特朗普回国前转向更便宜的巴西大豆
item.description: 由于担心华盛顿会在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普于1月20日就职后征收进口关税，中国大豆加工商已转向价格具有竞争力的巴西货物，而不是美国油籽。【原文：Chinese soybean processors have turned to competitively priced Brazilian cargoes instead of U.S. oilseeds, amid fears Washington will impose import tariffs after President-elect Donald Trump takes office on Jan. 20.】

item.title: 美国对俄罗斯实施新制裁，全球柴油价格飙升
item.description: 根据分析师和伦敦证交所集团（LSEG）的数据，在美国对俄罗斯石油贸易实施最新一轮制裁后，全球柴油价格和炼油利润率飙升，因为人们预期这些措施将收紧供应。【原文：Global diesel prices and refining margins spiked following the latest round of U.S. sanctions on Russia's oil trade on expectations the measures would tighten supplies, according to analysts and LSEG data.】

item.title: 台积电首席执行官称，台积电美国工厂不可能先于台湾获得最新芯片技术
item.description: 台积电首席执行官表示，由于复杂的合规问题、当地建筑法规和各种许可要求，台积电在美国的新工厂不太可能先于台湾工厂获得最先进的芯片技术。【原文：TSMC's new U.S. plant is unlikely to get the most advanced chip technology before factories in Taiwan due to complex compliance issues, local construction regulations and various permitting requirements, the Taiwanese company's CEO said.】
